maqras.text: I swear (or call to witness) this City (Mecca)
And you (Muhammad) are a dweller of this City
And the (mystic ties) of Parent and Child
We have surely created man in suffering (struggle, trouble, sorrow)
Does he think that none has power over him
He says, "I have squandered wealth in plenty
Does he think that no one sees him
Have We not made for him two eyes
And a tongue, and two lips
And guided him in the two highways
But he has not attempted the ascent
And what will explain to you the ascent
It is freeing captives (or prisoners, slaves, the restricted or bound)
Or feeding on the day of privation
An orphan who is a kin
Or a destitute lying in the dust (of misery)
And again (it is) to be of those who believe and encourage each other to patience, and encourage each other to mercy
These are the fellows of the right
But those who disbelieve in our signs, they are the fellows of the left
For them is the enclosing Fire
By the sun and its noonday brightness
And the moon when it follows him
And the day when it displays him
And the night when it covers him
And the wondrous structure of the heavens and Him who built it
And the earth and Who spread it
And the soul and Who fashioned it
And enlightened it with what is wrong and right for it
He indeed is successful who causes it to grow (or purifies it)
And he indeed is a failure who corrupts it
The Thamud people denied (the Messenger) in their rebellious pride (or outrage)
When the basest of them rose up
And the Messenger of Allah (Salih) said to them, "(This is) AllahÂ´s she-camel! So give her to drink
But they called him a liar, and they ham-strung her; so their Lord destroyed them in their sins, and served them all alike
And He fears not the result thereof
By the night when it veils
And the day when it is displayed
And by (the mystery) of male and female
Verily, your efforts are diverse
But as for him who gives alms and fears Allah
And believes in goodness
We will ease his way to ease
But as for him who is niggardly and thinks himself independent (or self-sufficient)
And calls the good a lie
We will ease his way to misery (adversity)
And his wealth shall not avail him when he falls down (into hell)
Verily, it is for Us to guide
And, verily, Ours are the Latter and the Former life
Therefore, I have warned you of a Fire that flames fiercely
None shall broil thereon, but the most wretched
Who says it is a lie and turns his back
But the pious shall be kept away from it
He who gives his wealth that he may grow
And who gives no favour expecting a return
But only desiring the face of his Lord Most High
In the end he shall be well fulfilled
By the glorious morning light
And the night when it is still
Your Lord has not forsaken you (Muhammad), nor is displeased with you
And surely the Hereafter is better for you than the present
And in the end your Lord will give you, and you shall be well pleased
Did He not find you an orphan, and give you protection
And find you wandering (or astray), and guide you
And find you in need, and enriched you (or made you independent)
Therefore, the orphan oppress him not
Nor the beggar (or petitioner) drive away
And as for the favour of your Lord, discourse (proclaim) thereof
